file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 34-27-01-04 - DUAL IRS - INERTIAL REFERENCE UNIT - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL DUAL IRS - INERTIAL REFERENCE UNIT - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedure to remove/install the IRU - Inertial Reference Unit. B. IRU1 is installed on the left side of the electronic compartment. C. IRU2 is installed on the right side of the electronic compartment. D. The access to IRU1 and IRU2 is got through access panel 113CZ in the forward electronic compartment. E. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 34-27-01-000-801-A IRU - REMOVAL ALL 34-27-01-400-801-A IRU - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 34-27-01 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 34-27-01-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. IRU - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to remove the IRU. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - HYDRAULIC SYSTEM - PRESSURIZATION WITH AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-802-A/200 EMDP SAFETY PIN OF THE NLG DOORS SOLENOID AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200 VALVE - INSTALLATION AND REMOVAL SB145-32-0036 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 213 113CZ LH Electronic Compartment 214 113CZ RH Electronic Compartment D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Forward Electronic Compartment I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) On aircraft PRE-MOD SB145-32-0036, make sure that the pressure in hydraulic system 1 is fully released ( AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-802-A/200). (2) On aircraft POST-MOD SB145-32-0036, install the safety pin of the NLG door solenoid valve (AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200). (3) Open access door 113CZ (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 34-27-01 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (4) On the Circuit Breaker Panel, open the IRS 1 and/or IRS 2 circuit breaker(s) and attach a DO-NOT-CLOSE tag to it (them). (5) On the ELECTRICAL panel, on the overhead panel, push the BACKUP pushbutton (striped bar comes on). J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Loosen the two self-locking retainers (2) until they disconnect from the support hooks. (2) Remove the IRU (1). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 34-27-01 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL IRU - Removal/Installation Figure 401 A ZONES 213 214 B DET. A 1. IRU DET. B 2. SELF-RETAINERS 145AMM340341.MCE EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 34-27-01 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 34-27-01-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. IRU - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to install the IRU. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - SAFETY PIN OF THE NLG DOORS SOLENOID AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200 VALVE - INSTALLATION AND REMOVAL AMM TASK 34-27-00-700-801-A/500 DUAL IRS - OPERATIONAL TEST DUAL IRS - MOUNTING TRAY LEVELING/ALIGN- AMM TASK 34-27-00-700-802-A/500 MENT SB145-32-0036 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 213 113CZ LH Electronic Compartment 214 113CZ RH Electronic Compartment D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Forward Electronic Compartment I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A CAUTION: WHEN YOU PUT THE UNIT ON THE MOUNTING TRAY, DO NOT FORCE FIT. IF MATING IS DIFFICULT, REMOVE THE UNIT AND MAKE SURE THAT THE CONNECTOR PINS ARE NOT BENT OR OUT OF ALIGNMENT. ALSO, VISUALLY EXAMINE THE ALIGNMENT OF THE RECEPTACLE ON THE MOUNTING TRAY. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 34-27-01 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (1) Put the IRU (1) on the mounting tray. Move it onto the three guide pins. Move the unit rearward until its connectors are fully engaged with the mating connectors of the mounting tray. (2) Tighten the self-retainers (2) over the support hooks to attach the unit in position. NOTE: If the mounting tray is moved out of position, a complete tray alignment must be done ( AMM TASK 34-27-00-700-802-A/500). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Close access door 113CZ (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (2) On aircraft POST-MOD SB145-32-0036, remove the safety pin of the NLG door solenoid valve (AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200). (3) On the circuit breaker panel , close the IRS1 and/or IRS2 circuit breaker(s) and remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag from it (them). (4) On the ELECTRICAL panel, on the overhead panel, push the BACKUP pushbutton (striped bar comes off). (5) Do the IRS Operational Check ( AMM TASK 34-27-00-700-801-A/500). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 34-27-01 Page 6 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
